intro: Astragalus insulae-karpathi, commonly known as the Karpathian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the island of Karpathos in the Aegean Sea. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, dry environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Astragalus insulae-karpathi is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
